Subjective: Difficulty passing hard stools for 3 months; abdominal pain; abdominal cramps; bloating; no change in appetite; underweight; no blood in stool; tried olive oil for softer stools; family history of ulcerative colitis; request: concerned about condition, wants to know if serious; wants to soften stools.
Objective: Vitals: not recorded; Abdomen: tender to palpation in LLQ, varying tympani, dampening in LLQ; Bowel sounds: normal; No fever, no headache, no weight loss, no change in urination, regular periods.
Assessment: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS); ruled out: no signs of cauda equina, no alarm bells for serious condition.
Plan: • Psyllium fibre sachets, 1 sachet/day with plenty of water for 6 weeks; • Follow-up in 6 weeks to evaluate results; • Safety net: if abdominal pain worsens, fever develops, or blood appears in stool, return sooner; • Discuss dietitian referral at next visit.
